number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												By itself, Call of Pripyat is alright and mostly recommendable - way better than Clear Sky, but still far from delivering on the original promise of the STALKER concept. As all of them, CoP is genuinely at its best when you're left to roam freely, explore, scavenge, pick your own battles and soak in the atmosphere. The linear parts of the game are forgettable and the graphics, well, I guess there the engine is starting to show it's age. But it's pretty alright.However, the Misery mod for Call of Pripyat makes it an absolute hardcore survival masterpiece. It is by far the toughest, most fully-featured, and mercilessly dreary single-player survivor shooter out there - nothing comes even close. It always walks that fine line between jaw-droppingly challenging, frightening and just kind of stupidly insane, and that definitely makes it not everyone's cup of tea. The name doesn't lie - you can say a lot of things about Misery, but it's hard to call it "fun". It is a game out to murder you, both with bullets and monster claws, AND with its complex inventory/item/health/trade system which forces you to think about a lot more than just armor and bullets. Maintaining your health, stamina and the state of your gear isn't simply a matter of walking up to a couple of stations and spending some currency - oh no, this game throws one of the most arcane inventory/item/stats management systems out there at you while providing virtually no instructions, charts or stats bars, only vague indicators. For every new nifty acquisition there is a price - cheap food is radioactive, suits with gas masks constrain and muddy your vision, and carrying more than just bare necessities makes you constantly run out of stamina, even from just walking. It gives you few cues on who is friend and foe, and foes will drop you with deathly-accurate fire from long range. You will die. A lot. But in the process of making you miserable, Misery inspires not just respect and curiosity for the Zone (like STALKER games are wont to do), but sheer awe and terror of the place. It's a game that, many times, made me basically forget everything I was doing and RUN for my (virtual) life, as far as my realistically-puny stamina would allow - not through scripted setpieces like horror games do, but through sheer incidental immersion in the gameworld, which I knew at that moment just happened to be randomly trying to murder me. Even after many days of play, it repeatedly turned me into a lowly scavenger, hunting mutated pigs for something to eat, racing NPCs to a dead bodies just to get some loot off it before they cleaned it all up, and spending as much as 2 weeks of game-time just to scrounge up enough cash for a brand new gun that - gasp - actually works and doesn't jam all the damn time!So yeah, while I think Call of Pripyat by itself is just barely recommendable as an alright game, I give a very hearty recommendation to the Misery mod - with the warning that it takes a certain kind of masochistic player to properly enjoy its hatefully hardcore survival charm.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is a sequel to S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow Of Chernobyl, but has very little to do with the prequel except for the gameplay similarities and that they both are located in ''The Zone'' which is the irradiated area  surrounding the nuclear power plant Chernobyl and the city of Pripyat in Ukraine, needless to say, other than that the whole scenario is fictional. S.T.A.L.K.E.R is a Horror/Survival FP Shooter game developed by GSC Game World.General Information and story:You start as an USS Major Degtyarev and you are sent in to ''The Zone'' to investigate a failed operation called ''Operation Fairway''. This operation was planned to take the the Chernobyl NPP by force from the current forces holding it known only by the name ''Monolith''. The operation was a failure and all the stingray helicopters crashed in a suspicious way. So there you  are and you're mission is clear, but as you advance in the story it gets everything but clear, the pilots that are dead or killed all died in an extraordinary way except for those who died by the impact of the crashing helicopter, and some of the helicopters appear to be disfuctional even before they hit the ground. You're mission is a solo effort to find out why Operation Fairway was a failure, but as you progress through The Zone you have to work among the local stalkers which are the people wondering around and exploring The Zone brought there by various reasons. You may choose to work alongside the stalkers or rob them as a bandit either way you will have buddies. Stalkers make the most money, which is a luxury in The Zone, by hunting Artifacts which are items formed in an anomalous area, after getting artifacts they sell them to traders who trade them to the outside world. Artifacts have strange abilities like healing abilities. The Zone is a strange and dangerous place which makes the majors mission anything but easy. The Zone is full of dangerous anomalies, radiation, bandits, madmen, criminals and even mutated animals and people!You're mission leads you to the center of The Zone to city of Pripyat where you meet up with the remaining soldiers from Operation Fairway, There you can choose to do something about the Monolith and soon find out more about how the helicopters crashed. As it turns out the monolith have a secret weapon which works with electric energy from artifacts and uses batteries for ''magazines'' the weapon is called Gauss Rifle and the helicopters were shot down. in the end you are given a option to leave The Zone or to find out more about the Gauss Rifle and the Monolith or about The Zone, so the story is only so good how mutch time you put in to it. Like any other game you can just rush it out or take time with it and S.T.A.L.K.E.R is one where you should totally invest some time otherwise it's easily looked over because of it's graphical issues and it's cheap look, but the truth is S.T.A.L.K.E.R is anything but cheap! It may lack a perfect story but the atmosphere and feel is like any other, S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many intersting side missions and stories and the fact that it loosely is related to reality and has a realistic feel to it makes it an unmatched expirience in this kind of genre. Gameplay:Gameplay of S.T.A.L.K.E.R is very unique in my oppinion, it combines FPS gameplay with survival elements such as hunger and radiation sickness and the need to sleep with horror and even RPG elements such as simple stats, different weapons and armor, economy, side missions and exploring. Combined with the enviroment the gameplay fits like a glove even if it has a few downsides. The downsides are mostly minor things such as repeated lines from NPC's and buggy animations, other than that it's O.K. All in all the gameplay is something quite different from other compareable games and in a good way! S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat can attract fans of many genres. Multiplayer is nothing special, you're typical DM, TDM witch areas from the singleplayer.Graphics:The game was first released in 2009 so the graphics are a bit old but i wouldn't say that they look terrible, they aren't the diamond either there is a lot of room for improvement in here but especially in the animations. The game uses the X-Ray engine and has been updated to version 1.6 with DirectX 11. The games graphics can be enhanced with several mods that are avaliable through the web. I haven't found any major problems that mods have not been able to fix.Other:One thing that must be said about Call Of Pripyat is the large quantity of different mods that are avaliable, apparently S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans are loyal to game and have made a lot of great mods for people to play. Allmost every problem and aspect of the game can be fixed/enhanced with large or small mods. I recommend playing the game with one major mod before declaring it a piece of trash.Verdict:S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call Of Pripyat is  allmost a ground breaking title. Call Of Pripyat lacks the appearence to catch peoples eyes but is a beautyful game in many aspects. S.T.A.L.K.E.R in my oppinion has no problems the mods can't fix. All in all it is a refreshing title and a great expirience for a fan of any genre and has a feel and atmosphere like any other. Story is nothing special but keeps you interested to the end plus S.T.A.L.K.E.R has many great side missions. You can easily put 40 to 50 hours to this game and still not have played every little bit, depending on your difficulty and playstyle of course. S.T.A.L.K.E.R Call of Pripyat is excellent singleplayer expirience!9/10

content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
												The STALKER series is notorious for being an amaziing immersive astmospheric mix of FPS, RPG and Horror. Call of Pripyat is by far the best in the series when it comes to guns and ccombat. Finding a gun you really like and being able to upgrade your weapon to how you want and putting your life and trust into one gun to help survive out in the harsh world of STALKER makes the atmosphere and immersion far beyond any FPS game has ever even came close to. The world of Pripyat makes for a great RPG and creepy atmoshere. Creeping around at night in the dark with all the horrible sounds going on around you makes you really appreciate a good atmosphere in a game and also that your gun is fully loaded and your reflexes are fast enough to be ready for what could be coming at your through the darkness at any moment. Open world and plenty of side quests and NPC to make for a great RPG and enough guns to keep you playing for hours. Although the story starts off pretty good, it ends pretty weak compared to Shadow of Chernobyl, which has an amazing story with 13 endings! DDo yourself a favor and buy the whole series and then download STALKER Complete for each game. These are bug fix mods and tweaks. They fix most if the major glitches and problems the vanilla games have. Also, check out LURK ffor Shadow Chernobyl and Misery for Call of Pripyat for the best possible way to play STALKER - Shadow of Chernoyble and STALKER Call of Pripyat.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2015
												TOTALLY RECOMMENDED - if you are not afraid of some scary and lonely moments in the zone. People are not friendly in this game, nor should you be. In this game you will learn to survive, thinking only for yourself.I bought it recently because this game has a really good rating on steam. I played S.T.A.L.K.E.R.  Shadow of Chernobil - so I'm not new to this genre.I downloaded it, installed it (and because its from 2010) I also installed the misery 2.1.1 mod from moddb. It enhances the game with nice updated graphics but also includes a lot of ingame content/changes (very recommended)What did I receive for my money?A scary, dark game. Ultra high difficulty level. its no more 'learning the game' - 'EZ frags'. Its f****** damn hard to play now. It's a real challenge. Many quests, some you start, and you dont really know, what will happen. Very deep feelings, very atmospheric.  If you took some russian lessions in CS:GO, this one is like the final exam. I also want to mention, that this game is an offline-RPG game (even-though it has a multiplayer-deathmatch like thing). So its a game you can enjoy for hours, when internet is not availlable.Cheers.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
Product received for free
												The main story is basic and fine, you have to check why 5 helicopters crashed, and through that process do all the other smaller quests. Although the final mission was quite boring, shot some slow soldiers then shot normal soldiers, with snipers.A good sequel to the Stalker games, a more tight experience, as the 3 maps it provides are full of stuff to do, except for the 3rd one which has just a few quests.The first time I played it I gave up after a few minutes, mostly because you do not start at a base, you have to find it.You also start with horrible equipment and a viable strategy is to let other NPCs kill each other and loot the dead before they do, at least until you get decent gear.Mutants do not drop anything anymore, so killing them outside of a quest is pointless.A new mechanic is artifact hunting, where you will use a radar to find artifacts that spawn near dangerous anomalies. Although now you need body armor with "artifact containers" to even equip them, and I only found 2 that had any.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R. ranks easily in one of my favorite games of all time. It's an unstable, bug-laden, often-mistranslated with cheating AI piece of game, but god does it do something good.The ambience, the stress, the setting, the mechanics... Everything that makes an open-world survival game great, way before the recent survival craze on steam. The game is hard as balls by concept, and would have it no other way. If it reminds you of the Metro series, well, there's a good reason: much of the same people who worked for GSC Game World fo the Stalker series went to do Metro for 4A games. In a sad turn of events, GSC Game World screwed over its employees, and has basically died since this game has come out, so we might never see a S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game again.Call of Pripyat is arguably the best game in the series due to it relative stability and more mature gameplay mechanics, where Shadow of Chernobyl feels rough around the edges and Clear Sky is just instable and buggy as balls. The main character story was more interesting in Shadow, was utterly uninteresting in Clear Sky, and is mildly interesting this time around in CoP due to a few other characters,,,You like FPSes, survival games, getting out of here stalker, open-world games, russians swearing, looking at X-Ray engine crash dumps, and crouching in radioactive mud because you're being sniped at midnight by bandits? Buy this game. Now,

content:
Posted: November 4, 2013
												When you're going into The Zone, you know that you might not come back.  But if you do, you might just get rich.In the utter wasteland of Chernobyl things are getting worse.  And strange.  Mutants and monsters roam, the very laws of physics bend and break and the sky rains death in erruptions.  In this horrible place dubbed "The Zone",  military, rogue and secret factions war  for the secrets the zone is hiding.  Secrets that could free or end the world.STALKER Call of Pripyat is the finest in freeroaming wasteland adventure.  The non-scripted nature of this game will feed you a constant stream of emergent storytelling.  Don't miss this game.Also, read the wonderful Russian short story this series is based on called "Roadside Picnic", which is a free download somewhere.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												The third STALKER game finds itself as the first one I played the entire way through. The polish is actually there, the guns are much improved. Mission design isn't actually bugged and the game can be much easier than previous entries. I much prefer to recommend it to others over the first two, because it follows a more Bethesda-RPG path and is a bit more open world, with 3 major maps and 6 contained zones. The meeting areas in the ship, train-station and laundramat bring back the whole comfort in numbers/fear in solitude dynamic that Clear Sky messed up on.Though, the broken messes of the original's demise seemed to suck a bit of the STALKER magic from the game. Every location is played out on the map and seems to all share a purpose, some more obvious than others. I wish loners would populate some of these areas after the threat has cleared, it sometimes feels some of these were just left fortotten.Duty & Freedom find themselves with reduced numbers, with control only over Yanov, so the large scale fights feel very toned down. Even in the game's third act in Pripyat I was really expecting some sort of large scale battle, because the shootouts in Pyripyat in ShoC or the assault on the Freedom HQ led themselves to some of the highlights in prior games. X-8 played situational horror more than anthing more subtle in prior labs, or the huge army of monolith in X-19The graphics are stunning in a very bizarre game. Its 6 years old and I've yet to see more involving shadow effects. Some may be technically more subtle but none actually change the enviornment as much. The new Chimera can be one scary ♥♥♥♥♥ to find out in the open.Well the third act was lined with disappointments the endgame of actual freeroam is a haven to players who loved the RPG aspects over all else, and they included enough of a threat to not suck the fun out of the game.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												Although this game is great alone. With mods it is waaaay more enjoyable. Arsenal with 60 new armos and 200 new weapons is great. Atmosphere 3 is usually included with all of the larger mods. But, Misery. Dear God, Misery. It scares people off because its incredibly difficult. It shouldn't though, it's extremely immersive, letting you live an actual life in the zone, doing what you want to do as a Loner Stalker. Misery is if anything, playable forever, there is so much micromanaging, as far as waking up in the morning, planning on observing a certain area, deciding to go in for the kill, and planning your raid, to cleaning your weapon, to setting up camp for the night and just putting food on the table, to watching your radiation and other needs, to planning a hunting trip to make reap a god kill and harvest the goods. I've been playing this game for a long time, I live for immesive realism games, ArmA, DayZ, Ranger Hardcore on Metro, Master difficulty on the vanilla S.T.A.L.K.E.R., never have I actually woken up in real life, got showered, breakfast, etc. And decided to plan out my ingame day over a real life cup of coffee on a Saturday morning. If you want something real, something that makes you feel like you have to earn it, all of these games, you play♥♥♥♥♥the main character, gunslinging, medkit addicted, bullet eating protagonist with a misson and everyone stepping out of your way for your story the world revolving around you. But not Misery, in Misery your just some everyday stalker, walking in eating your flesh (the ingame monster) bacon wrapped in brown papar to keep the grease from dripping (actual description, immersion is life) planning on going for that artifact today, or that camp, the rounds your taking for your gun, the equipment you'll need for that area, maybe a sleeping bag and a safe place, incase youre out ill nightfall or an emission happens all of the sudden. In order to be a badass gunslinging veteran stalker, you had to train yourself and learn to be a badass stalker, absolutely no handholding in the mod. Misery will make you feel like you're there, but its not for everybody, the mod is infamously difficult, harder than Dark Souls, harder than the original Ninja Gaiden (well maybe not THAT hard *cringes at Ninja Gaiden*), at any moment something could leap from the marshes or shadows, whether it be a enemy stalker bullet, or the claws of a bloodsucker, if you're not on your toes with some real friggin' reflexes, you will die. A lot of times, no matter how good you are, sometimes you just get unlucky and a stary bullet will nail your head ending your journey in the zone. If your a serious immersion freak, wondering how you would really do in the zone (with basic knowledge of weaponry and cooking and medicenes) Misery is for you. If you like things tough, but still want to be a bit on top of everything else, try Master difficulty with Arenal Overload. However, the game is enjoyable and incredible regardless, 10/10!

												I've played a lot of games. A LOT of games. This one, however, is special. I can't quite tell you why. The controls were clunky at times, the graphics were nothing awe inspiring, hell, the voice acting was terrible. It has this attraction though. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 7, 2011
												BEST GAME EVERMy favorite games create an atmosphere that acts as a world of the game.  When I play Call of Pripyat, or the original S.T.A.L.K.E.R. I feel as though I am truly in "The Zone".   It's not all that welcoming of an environment but in the STALKER series I feel like I'm actually stepping into another world.  Think of it as the Russian equivalent of the recent additions to the Fallout Series, with no hand holding.  There are missions but don't expect much in the way of an in-game interface when it comes to ongoing quests.  You'll get a marker on your map and that's about it.Weapons in the game feel realistic, don't expect to take out an enemy in one shot.  Ammo is scarce and weapons degrade overtime.STALKER: Call of Pripyat was the first game to use DirectX 11, and although I still find the graphics to be just fine, several mods exist that completely overhaul the games looks.  STALKER Complete has long been the best and most well known but a newer mod called MISERY completely retools everything; the graphics, the difficulty(as if the game was not challenging enough already), the weapons, weather, everything.   If you are on the fence at all about buying this game check out the MISERY mod.   But do yourself a favor and play through the game once in vanilla before you go shaking things up with MISERY.Here's a link...  http://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-miseryand...              http://www.miserymod.com/And do not judge my recorded playtime.  I have played this game for well over 100 hours while offline, which Steam does not record.   Do yourself a favor and pick this game up the instant it goes on sale (the developers have long since disbanded - some went on to make the METRO 2033 series) or trade for it or do whatever you have to do to add this game to your library.  If I had to pick 5 games to keep on my Steam account, after CSGO and TF2, STALKER would be my number one choice of games that I would keep.  (I would also keep Tales of Maj'Eyal and number 5 would be a toss-up).Even with a dev that is no longer in business STALKER has a thriving mod community and continues to be improved upon.  So just as I feel that I am entering another world when I play it, "The Zone" continues to be a living breathing and ever changing world.

You're the Major. You don't have a cybernetic body, but you can somehow survive lethal amounts of radiation by drinking lots of vodka. Enemies clog up doorways with their corpses. And if you're like me you made the emissions turn people into zombies.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Like any Stalker game I started out confused and overwhelmed. I was not sure where to go or what to do exactly. After a short while I began to figure things out and was noticing nice changes from the previous games. The story this time around is much more coherent than the original. The missions are similar to the other Stalkers but they seem to guide you along better. The original game would give me missions and no map marker for them, or the marker would be wrong. That caused many frustrating hours. I played through the majority of the new missions without any problems at all. It was quite a relief.The inventory system has been overhauled. It is a much cleaner interface and your weapons and armor are upgradeable. Also there are onscreen notifications if your weapons or armor start to wear down. Unlike the first two games you are able to repair items in CoP. The health system functions the same way, with bleeding and ruptures. You can also find and use many artifacts that give you certain bonuses as well as a nice dose of radiation. Though the artifacts were not nearly as prevalent as they were in the first two games.A lot of the same enemies make their way back into this sequel but are deadlier. The most memorable occurrence was my first bloodsucker encounter. It actually grabbed a hold of me and began to drain my blood. A truly frightening experience when it is pitch dark and the creature moves around invisible.The Stalker series is definitely not for every one. It is dark, gritty, and can sometimes be anxiety inducing. Yet I would still recommend it to anyone interested in shooters with some rpg elements. Once you get over the sleight learning curve it is truly a satisfying experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												Third part in the STALKER series. STALKER Call Of Pripyat brings out into the light Major Alexander Degtyarev.The protagonist is an agent for the Ukraine Security Service and his(your) task is to investigate the failure of the mission "Operation Fairway". You start undercover in a new area of The Zone and you're immediately sent into surviving since there is a long way until your first objective and safe area.The game picks up from where STALKER SoC left it and has improved graphics,map size and keeps all the changes Clear Sky had. In CoP the devs removed the quests for data required for upgrading your gear and they added tools that the mechanics can use(read the quests for instructions where to find them or Google it ). The user can easily explore and he can find hidden stashes no matter if they have or don't have the coords on his PDA.The game has only 3 huge areas with good quests, achievements, underground laboratories, new weapons and new information the military has left behind.It's your decision what to do with the information found and who do you want to help. At the end of the game the user encounters a familiar face that brings the knowlege of The Zone.Pros-Exoskeleton can now be upgraded and the user can run. ( later in the game )- Wonderful quests and new beautiful areas.- More nice stuff you don't want to miss- Work for what you want.Cons- Only 3 areas-Almost impossible to achieve good ending final mission being too hard.A true STALKER has no cons.I recommend that the user does all the quests for the full experience Call of Pripyat offers and I also recommend that you play this as vanilla for the best STALKER experience then you can mod it and have fun.Order of gameplay - STALKER CLEAR SKY -> STALKER SHADOW OF CHERNOBYL -> STALKER CALL OF PRIPYATOrder of appearance - STALKER SHADOW OF CHERNOBYL - STALKER CLEAR SKY - STALKER CALL OF PRIPYATWatch your back STALKER !

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												I've replayed this game maybe 3 times now. It is a DAMNED good game in terms of creating a world that can really immerse you. Many times I've found myself wandering the Chernobyl wasteland and believing that I was actually in this depressing and dangerous world that STALKER has created. The graphics are dated (one of the first games to utilize dx11) but definitely not enough to take you out of that immersion. Some mods have added more graphical aspects that will immerse you even more so I recommend you look them up. The game itself runs pretty well and it does a superb job of setting up the atmosphere.For example, there are many decrepit buildings and sites that are riddled with strange and sometimes paranormal entities waiting to kill you, from zombies, bloodsuckers to "poltergeists" and even giant mutant things. This game will scare the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of you on many occasions. The world feels "alive" and many events happen as you pass it by (by alive I mean the♥♥♥♥♥♥out there waiting to kill you is palpable). This and the first STALKER really set the bar on how to make an immersive world using the nuclear disaster setting. You will find yourself replaying it after a while because the world is THAT interesting and many events can happen differently every playthrough. Pick it up on a sale, or buy it cause it really is that good of a game!

You learn quickly not to just shoot on sight and also there are moments you need to get into cover, makes night hunting a little more nerve racking, because of emissions that can kill instantly. I really enjoyed the stealth and weapon modifications as well as the side quests and character quests. Also, there are amazing mods that just massively improve the gameplay to push it to the most amazing experience possible! A great ending if done right.

Perhaps the sci-fi lore, or the freedom to do as I please in a world that feels the same freedom. Treasure hunting artifacts in hazardous areas, or trying to consolidate all the loot from all the people i've killed, or cautiously entering dark rooms with who knows what kind of mutated horror. The company is dead, and so is the game, but I will NEVER forget ths one.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												Fun game. Pretty difficult (I'm playing on the second highest difficulty), but the "huh, that tactic doesn't work against mutated slavic hillbillies that can kill me telepathically; let's try again!" kind of difficult, rather than the "I will rip a small child in half if I have to do this quest again!" kind of difficult. It's pretty spooky, but not because of scripted jump scares- it's all about the atmosphere. How close was that mutated wolf-bear thing that just howled? What's up with all the gunshots? Was that thunder or- *neck bitten by vampire-cuddlefish thing* nope, those were footsteps. The story isn't really central to the game, but who cares about that when they're immersed in a three way player-vs-bandits-vs-mutants shootout in the middle of a radioactive anomaly field? No one!PS, I'm running this game on Windows 7 and it has some issues with lag and framerate drops; based on Youtube videos I've seen, it works better on XP.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												Arguably this is the best of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series, either this or clear sky. Clear sky is longer, but more flawed.  This game is shorter, and is only 3 areas (really, REALLY big areas), but the game feels more alive.  The quests are better overall, and for once you get to form a group of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.s, although only for one mission (nothing like the zombie mission from Clear Sky).  The mutants are scarier than ever, and the new chimera is a fearsome beast.  The origins of the monolith faction are finally clearly explained (although clever players knew what was up already).  If you haven't beaten clear sky then the true origins of the zone will remain a mystery to you in this game, with a cursory intro and a couple of dialogue options here and there being your only explanation (although it is not at all central to the plot).  The plot is fairly weak, but fun so it doesn't really matter.  what is really good is the world crafting, it is really fun just running around collecting artifacts, hunting mutants, and completing misssions.  Collecting and upgrading different guns can also be really fun, but experienced players will quickly find some guns are Much better than others.  The atmosphere and sound is top notch, I highly recommend if you like environmental horror games and fps games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat could best be described as a mixture between Fallout, Metro 2033, and a touch of Mount and Blade. This game does not hold your hand, you are thrusted into the chaotic world of post-apocalyptic Russia with no tutorials or even goals given. It is easy enough to figure out how to follow the main quest, and side missions aren't revealed with an exclamation point over the quest-giver's head. The gunplay is surprisingly impressive as your weapons will break the more you shoot. Enemies are somewhat creative though they can become an annoyance as they are sometimes tough to shoot. But all in all, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is definitely worth a try.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
ImpressionI've finished S.T.A.L.K.E.R. trilogy 2 weeks ago and still don't know what to do with myself ;) Living outside the Zone really sucks. As someone said, "you can get stalker out of the zone, but you can't get zone out of the stalker".Summary - S.T.A.L.K.E.R. in few wordsTo sum it up, the most important points of this game are:1. Atmosphere2. Atmosphereand last but not least3. Atmosphereand of course, as a special bonus4. Cheeki breeki & many other hilarious moments in this grim world like: technician won't upgrade your weapon unless he gets:* tools* vodkaI have to warn you though - this game is hard, even on default difficulty level, something called a "hardcore mode" in Fallout Nev Vegas is just an usual day for a real slav in the Zone ;) You have to eat (especially after vodka), you're getting tired - it's not possible to run constantly while carrying dozen of guns on your back, bullets have weight, medicaments don't heal you instantly and headshots really hurt... and kill. Nowadays, when most of game developers assume that average player is a mentally ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cripple who plays using feet, such game is like a rare gem.But I also strongly recommend to complete whole S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series on vanilla version before trying mods. Don't be a sissy, just make friendship with quick save / quick load buttons ;)RatingFinal score: would be 10/10 if the game wasn't simply out of the scale ;)+ * Damn, everything-* Too short, fortunately there are many mods to explore* There's no Stalker 2 yet :/* Bandits don't camp in slav squat position ;)So, "get out of here stalker" and see you in the Zone!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
												The S.T.A.L.K.E.R series will always be one of my favorite FPS's. The game is scary, fun, difficult (but in a good way), and, IMO, has the best atmosphere in a game I've ever experienced. You get a certain feeling when playing this game that is hard to find in others, it's a feeling hard to describe. It also has that Russian charm, with all the characters speaking in thick russian accents and living completely off of a diet of sausages and vodka. It's also got a lot of replayability.In addition, the game also has one of the most devoted fanbases I have ever seen, right next to the Half-Life fanbase. Despite the last game (Call of Pripyat) being released way back in 2009, the fanbase still survives and even thrives off of fan films, a whole bunch of super well-made and extensive mods, art, MEMES, and users simply sharing the experiences they've had playing the game. I guarantee you'll be having a lot of fun with this game, even after you're done playing.Oh, and did I mention mods? Boy, are you in for a treat when it comes to mods. S.T.A.L.K.E.R has an amazing modbase. Even now, mods are still being made. Call of Chernobyl, Misery, Autumn Aurora, and so many others, all free and made by professionals. There are also a whole lot of upcoming mods, including a multiplayer mod.Sadly, the game suffers from Half Life syndrome. S.T.A.L.K.E.R 2 was in development but was quickly canceled due to a whole bunch of complex issues GSC Game World had to face. But GSC has made a comeback, having recently released Cossacks 3. So things are looking up for S.T.A.L.K.E.R!So, yeah, you should totally get this game. Now get out of here, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 7, 2011
												BEST GAME EVERMy favorite games create an atmosphere that acts as a world of the game.  When I play Call of Pripyat, or the original S.T.A.L.K.E.R. I feel as though I am truly in "The Zone".   It's not all that welcoming of an environment but in the STALKER series I feel like I'm actually stepping into another world.  Think of it as the Russian equivalent of the recent additions to the Fallout Series, with no hand holding.  There are missions but don't expect much in the way of an in-game interface when it comes to ongoing quests.  You'll get a marker on your map and that's about it.Weapons in the game feel realistic, don't expect to take out an enemy in one shot.  Ammo is scarce and weapons degrade overtime.STALKER: Call of Pripyat was the first game to use DirectX 11, and although I still find the graphics to be just fine, several mods exist that completely overhaul the games looks.  STALKER Complete has long been the best and most well known but a newer mod called MISERY completely retools everything; the graphics, the difficulty(as if the game was not challenging enough already), the weapons, weather, everything.   If you are on the fence at all about buying this game check out the MISERY mod.   But do yourself a favor and play through the game once in vanilla before you go shaking things up with MISERY.Here's a link...  http://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-miseryand...              http://www.miserymod.com/And do not judge my recorded playtime.  I have played this game for well over 100 hours while offline, which Steam does not record.   Do yourself a favor and pick this game up the instant it goes on sale (the developers have long since disbanded - some went on to make the METRO 2033 series) or trade for it or do whatever you have to do to add this game to your library.  If I had to pick 5 games to keep on my Steam account, after CSGO and TF2, STALKER would be my number one choice of games that I would keep.  (I would also keep Tales of Maj'Eyal and number 5 would be a toss-up).Even with a dev that is no longer in business STALKER has a thriving mod community and continues to be improved upon.  So just as I feel that I am entering another world when I play it, "The Zone" continues to be a living breathing and ever changing world.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Like any Stalker game I started out confused and overwhelmed. I was not sure where to go or what to do exactly. After a short while I began to figure things out and was noticing nice changes from the previous games. The story this time around is much more coherent than the original. The missions are similar to the other Stalkers but they seem to guide you along better. The original game would give me missions and no map marker for them, or the marker would be wrong. That caused many frustrating hours. I played through the majority of the new missions without any problems at all. It was quite a relief.The inventory system has been overhauled. It is a much cleaner interface and your weapons and armor are upgradeable. Also there are onscreen notifications if your weapons or armor start to wear down. Unlike the first two games you are able to repair items in CoP. The health system functions the same way, with bleeding and ruptures. You can also find and use many artifacts that give you certain bonuses as well as a nice dose of radiation. Though the artifacts were not nearly as prevalent as they were in the first two games.A lot of the same enemies make their way back into this sequel but are deadlier. The most memorable occurrence was my first bloodsucker encounter. It actually grabbed a hold of me and began to drain my blood. A truly frightening experience when it is pitch dark and the creature moves around invisible.The Stalker series is definitely not for every one. It is dark, gritty, and can sometimes be anxiety inducing. Yet I would still recommend it to anyone interested in shooters with some rpg elements. Once you get over the sleight learning curve it is truly a satisfying experience.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												Between the mods, the community (or crazies) that live and breath this game, and my own immutable curiousity of this title, I quickly realized that this was a solid purchase. I cant compare it to anything because nothing comes to mind. It feeels like a predecessor to Metro but I think that is only because they are both Russian. So thats not fair. But its precisely because it cant be easily grouped in with other games that you should buy it. Here are the mistakes I made that you should avoid. Do not immediately mod the game. It will be tempting. The All-In-One mod pack with AtmosFear 3 and Absolute Nature are just great. But without playing it vanilla first then you cant fully appreciate the mods. Dont spend your time making numerous saves because you arent sure what to sell and what to keep. Just go with it. Trust your gut. Move on. The game will be more fun. Also, pay attention to what people ssay. I lost focused during a few conversations fairly early on and I think I sold something that I needed to progress. Maybe I didnt. But I was stuck...somehow. And it was all because I got distracted by my GF yelling about something in the other room. It turned out to be a boy and now we are all very happy. I just wish she wouldnt distract me when Im trying to concentrate wheen its something she is perfectly capable of handling herself. The game is a classic. If you dont own it, get it. If you refuse to buy it get medicated and do not send me a friend request, ever.10/10 - would ignore a living room birth again

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												Game so fun you have to beat it more than once. Massive fan base that makes countless fun mods that include: Improved Graphics, Textures, animations, sound effects, new maps, monsters, items, weapons and the implement of online play. Story: you are an undercover military officer investigating the disappearance of multiple helicopters you are disguised as a stalker with just two weeks supply. The game drops you in a very difficult environment supply, trade and combat skills are key to survival, it may be very important sometimes to scout your area and must be careful when traveling at night so you don’t stumble upon mutated beast or radiated anomalies. High risk high reward is always a fun aspect for a game, this one shares that aspect when collecting artifacts in anomaly areas or when collecting loot during faction battles, before someone else does, while trying to not to become another by standard as bullets fly over your head. This game is one of my favorites it’s a must buy for any Survival game fan that enjoys challenges in beautiful landscapes of horrorProssound's from enviromental and gun soundMODS (GET MISERY MOD)Open worldAnimationsMultiple ending'sitem's have nice-quality picture'sGOOD STORYConsvoice acting

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												Right from the get-go, it should be said that this is a different game from Stalker Shadow of Chernobyl. In Shadow of Chernobyl (SoC), the entire game had a sense of mystery about it, a kind of unanswered questions vibe. It was a question of surviving the endless horrors of the Zone, of loud rain and calamitous thunder at night, and of breathtaking sunrises in the morning, as one gazes out at the brooding wilderness. It also encompassed a sense of massive and epic scale, as the player struggles for mere survival while the Monolith elite jealously guard the entrance to the Sarcophagus while the Ukrainian Military pours in all their best fighters, special forces armed to the teeth and guarded from above by a fleet of Mi-24 Hinds, to force their way through. Unsettling screams and distant gunfire at night, beautiful blood-red sunrises in the barren hills near the Army Warehouses, the haunting soundtrack of Cordon filling one's ears as stalkers wander aimlessly through the irradiated meadows, vengeance, melancholy, fear, and grandeur. THAT is the essence of SoC. Call of Pripyat gives off a different atmosphere. From the moment the player spawns, as he gazes out over the beautifully rendered swamps of Zaton, one gets the sense of opportunity. The Zone has been tamed, and there's money to be made here. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it does somewhat lessen the more emotional experience of SoC. Soundtrack was good. Weapons were unique and fun each in their own way, with customization available for most (they weakened my dear Ots-14! Waaaaaaaaaaaaaah!). Armor was plentiful, with many choices to pick (although no Merc Suit or Skat 9M). Characters were well-rounded, combat worked like a charm, the missions were sometimes tedious but on the whole more varied than the original game. I also particularly enjoyed the Factional Strife which one could get involved in in Call of Pripyat. I only wish that SoC had it. Playing the Loners and Bandits off on one another, or eschewing both in favor of the shadowy information dealer Owl makes the game much more lively, with some high-stakes plays to heighten the standing of your favoured faction. It is a pity one could not join the Mercenaries under Hatchet (what a swell guy!). I also liked the very idea of working with a fellow whose trade is the bartering of information (a valuable commodity in a place such as this!). I enjoyed the fact that some of these missions helped give one a sense of the scope of the Mercenary activities in the Zone, for they are without a doubt the most secretive faction.  Apparently they have some influential friends/allies. On the downside, I did not enjoy the fact that each weapon needed to be repaired before selling- this made the game much more difficult, especially since one needed to buy certain items in order to progress in the game. On the whole a fantastic game- not quite SoC, but worthy in its' own right.9.9/10

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Incredible atmosphere, challenging but not artificially difficult, impressive AI, and did I mention the atmosphere?The base game is great. The "Complete" mod is great for a first time player, and MISERY raises the immersion to levels where you are truly trying your best to survive in the Zone, hunting with your fellow STALKERs at the beginning to make your earnings by selling meat.There are few moments as memorable in gaming as my first contact with a controller, and this game will forever be remembered as one that did everything right, but appealed to too narrow an audience: players who like to take their time, get sucked into a world, and carefully plan their journey and reap their just rewards.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												This game is a gem, though it's still unpolished. It's frustrating, though better than the previous games, and yet I found it rewarding enough that I enjoyed strolling through the wasteland just for the hell of it. Pick it up on sale, and give it a shot. There are some interesting mods out there, but its not a huge community. It's unfortunate that the STALKER series never got a chance after CoP, because you can see the potential there in this game even if it's just never fully realized. It could have been a masterpiece, instead of a flawed cult classic.PS, love the bullet physics. The ballistics used in the game made combat fun for me, not a mindless chore. Bullet drop in CoP is maybe the most prominent in any game, and it feels wrong to me now when it is missing from FPS in open environs. Weapons have a certain feel, the weapon mod system allows you to modify it, and this for me made the game worth it.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is a mystery to me. There are SO MANY problems with it, and yet I still enjoyed playing it. Is it a great game? NO. But is it a good game? MAYBE. I have seen other reviews claim CoP is a better, more challening Fallout, but this is simply not true.VISUALSEverything in this game is repetitive and ugly. I have seen multiple reviews, even professional ones, claim that the visuals in this game are great, and I absolutely do not see why! I am not talking about graphics, which are so obviously below standard it's not even worth criticism. No, I mean atmosphere and appearance. First, every area of the game has the same open fields, short hills, boring trees, bushes, and grass. There is nothing in the natural scene that is beautiful or scary (I even installed Atmosfear, which is a beautification mod). Every building is square and industrial, filled with empty, useless rooms. This, far and above, is awful to look at. CoP is FILLED with identical buildings! Second, the oft-cited tense and scary atmosphere is present, albeit rarely. Truly scary or tense moments are governed by the RNG and therefore often missing. One of the "strengths" of this game, similar to Skyrim, is how independent the world is. Monsters and NPCs will spawn semi-randomly and often collide with the player and each other. However, this also means that the chances a creature will appear in empty building #127 that you exploring is actually very rare. Often I navigated a creepy abandoned factory (they're all factories, remember?) at night, with only a flashlight to guide me, all the while expecting some monstrosity to come at me, and NOTHING HAPPENED. I would find my loot, and go back to the safe zone, yet again. Boring. The best creepy moments, were the scripted ones at the end of the game! (which were few)COMBATThe second thing this game is known for is the FPS combat. One positive element of the game is that almost any enemy can kill you all by itself. Supposedly, this means you have to be very cautious in any combat situation and fight tactically. In reality, combat is the simplest rinse-and-repeat affair I have seen in many other games. Human enemies are a great example. If you are within firing range they WILL hit you (apparently every fool in the zone is an expert marksman) and kill you in a few shots. So, what is the strategy to defeat them? Easy: 1) hide behind cover, 2) pop out and headshot him, 3) consume a medkit to recover any damage. THAT'S IT. These three steps are pretty much the same for every enemy in the game, except for one that can go invisible (which is actually EASIER to kill). Headshots do very high damage (as they should in any serious FPS), but the moronic AI just stands there and shoots like a British Redcoat, so there is nothing stopping you from dropping enemies like flies. I have put hundreds of hours into TF2, so a headshot on a non-human player is like shooting fish in a barrel for me. I have literally stood in an open field, without cover, and killed four human attackers (NOT zombies) all firing at me without dying. Then, I just popped a couple medkits and waltzed away.WEAPONS/ARMOR/ITEMS*SPOILERS: I mention the names of weapon items, so if you want to learn them on your own, skip this section. *SPOILERS*There are many weapons in this game, however, half of them are nearly identical, many of them are completely useless, and the good weapons are both rare, and hardly used. First, all pistols are useless and can be abandoned in the first ten minutes of the game once you kill a single human enemy and take his rifle. Second, the first three assault rifles that you have access to are nearly identical, and the most common one you come across, the AKM-74/2, is a superior weapon for more than half the game. You can attach a scope and a grenade launcher to it. The next best rifle that is encountered in the second area of the game, TRs 301, is the literal successor to the first one. It too can be upgraded with scope and grenade launcher. This or the SGI-5k, will serve you for the rest of the game. Finally, all you need after this is a shotgun and again, the second shotgun you will likely encounter, the SPSA-14, will serve you for more than half the game. I easily beat the entire game with this assault rifle and shotgun combo. I never needed another weapon. There are several stronger special weapons, but the big problem is, you don't have access to them until you reach the final level, which is something like 80% into the game! So you get these cool new weapons, and no time to use them. BOO.Another note about weapons/armor. You can upgrade your weapons with technicians in safe areas, however, you have to find tools to give them to get access to the higher tier upgrades. It was an absolutely STUPID choice to put the final-tier tools in the last area of the game! Also, there is absolutely NO HINT where they are located, so you just have to exhaustively search every building in the final area to find them. What does this mean? Well, first, you will encounter every major enemy in the third area and kill it BEFORE you get the tools! Therefore, you will have fully explored the final area of the game BEFORE you can upgrade your weapons to the highest level! What that hell good is that!? What good is the amazing targeting scope on my sniper rifle when I already killed the 12 enemy fighters in the apartment building BEFORE I got it!? This is even worse with the armor. The best armor in the game does not allow you to run while wearing it until you have the final tier upgrade for it. Once again, this armor is completely uselss for 90% of the game.MAP LEVELSThe final frustrating element of this game is the map itself. So many players completely overlook that this game is really just a walking simulator. There is NO transportation or fast travel in this game. YOU. WALK. EVERYWHERE. Or more accurately, you sprint, walk, sprint, walk, eat a sausage, sprint, walk, sprint, walk, everywhere! You spend SO MUCH time walking! It's enfuriating. This game is not like Fallout/Skyrim where interesting events happen to you while you travel. At best you may happen upon some humans fending off a mutant attack. Honestly, the best strategy here is just to watch, because usually the mutants kill the humans, and you can loot their bodies. Otherwise, there is no reason to waste hours walking. To make matters worse, because your primary source of money in the game are special items called artifacts that are located in the far corners of each map and that respawn at random every few days, you will do A LOT of backtracking. Furthermore, the map is divided into three levels that you can only travel between by use of a guide. This "guide" is basically fast travel, since you talk to him, pay him money, and then you are instantly transported to the next area. You CANNOT access the other areas of the game on foot. You must PAY a guide to take you EVERY time you want to change levels (which is a lot). The reason for this is so obvious: the developers needed to separate all of the assets in the game so it wouldn't completely overload our computers. Finally, the third level of the game, which is really your primary goal, is both small and extremely short. What should be a climactic final level, is over in a handful of quests.Honestly, there are so many other things I could complain about, but I still choose to recommend this game because you can pick it up for nearly nothing during a sale. This game barely registers in the positive for me at a 6/10, but if you have a couple extra bucks come the next big sale, you may want to give it a try just to see what all the fuss is about.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												The first game, Shadow of Chernobyl, was one of the best games I've ever played. Clear Sky, the second installment to the franchise and a prequel to the first game, was an overwhelming disappointment. I was skeptical when coming to Call of Pripyat, but I can say without a doubt in my mind, that this is one of the greatest video games of all time.STORYWhere Clear Sky faltered with a dull story, Call of Pripyat brings forth a new, compelling, and interesting story that spans throughout untold countless hours of gameplay. For the first time, optional missions and side quests have their own stories, ranking among my favourites in RPGs. Memorable missions such as sneaking through a lair of sleeping Bloodsuckers, joining a team of hunters to kill a massive Chimera, overseeing a trade of information between enemy factions and then sniping them from a distance, and discovering the secrets hidden throughout the Pripyat area make the side missions a wonder to play through. While the central story isn't as deep and strong as the first game, it can be expanded upon through hundreds of optional missions which alone give the game far more replayability. A cast of new and surprisingly memorable characters filters into the game, all with their own distinctive and unique personality traits. For the first time, we finally get to go deeper into the city of Pripyat, to explore the old ruins of the world's biggest ghost town.GAMEPLAYStrong gunplay against intelligent enemy fighters and nightmarish mutants with a set of their own unique attacks ranks Call of Pripyat among some of the best FPS games I've ever played. Weapons will jam after prolonged use and wear, enemies will relentlessly and savagely attack you, flanking, taking cover, reacting in new and dynamic ways, even traveling around the world and engaging in fights among themselves. Suits and weapons can be seamlessly upgraded through assisting characters. This is undoubtedly the strongest of the series.GRAPHICSMuch like Clear Sky, the visuals just seem to fall flat. They're beautiful, most certainly, but there's simply little to no immersion like the first game. While there are haunting environments and surreal moments when you reach the dead city, I simply didn't get the same feelings that sparked through me as I assaulted the Brain Scorcher, fought waves of charging mutants, and battled my way inside the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Shadow of Chernobyl. Visually, the game does look quite good, though I am sorey disappointed to see that the beautifully detailed and ominous cutscenes present in the first two games are suddenly and without warning absent from Call of Pripyat. The jerky, awkward in-game cutscenes are laughable at best, and the slideshow cutscenes in the beginning and end of the game are groan inducing and all around pitiful attempts to recreate the CGI of the first to games. Nonetheless, graphically the game is stellar, and even running at medium settings the game still looks great.MULTIPLAYERUnfortunately, I have never seen more than one other person playing the multiplayer of this game, and therefore cannot make a full review on that particular portion. However, from what I've tested, the game modes look fun, gameplay is very much intact, and the new maps look interesting and well-detailed. If you have a few friends who want to play, a private lobby for this game looks like it could be unending fun.VERDICTS.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is a well polished, fun, entertaining, and overall incredible game. It took me nearly 17 hours to complete the main story, and I still haven't even scratched the surface of the overall package with the wealth of optional missions and exploration available to the player. While the story may not stack up to the mystery and horror of Shadow of Chernobyl, and while the survival/horror gameplay present in the first game is still quite lackluster, Call of Pripyat proves itself to be a fantastic experience. Had I not owned a PC of my own at the time of my playthrough of this game, I would have sold all of my consoles soley to play Call of Pripyat. A strong modding community keeps the game fresh and exciting, and I highly suggest that before playing, everyone install the S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat COMPLETE mod, as it enhances the visuals and adds a few new and fun mechanics that blend seamlessly with the central game. I didn't think anything could beat the first game, but this alone proves me wrong. The only true complaints I have are minor and do not derive from the full package. This is a game that I will be playing for years to come and still will find it new and fascinating each and every time I play. This is money well spent and perhaps one of the greatest video games ever made. With that said, the final verdict of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat, is an astounding 10/10. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll be trying to figure out how to kill all of these mutants and keep the bandits off my back.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												Great open-world game. If you like Fallout 3, then consider the STALKER series Fallout on steroids. Combat is intense, against both humans and mutants alike, and a single headshot from an enemy is enough to take you out. You have an absurd amount of freedom in this game. If you want to shoot the guy giving you a mission, you can. If you want to shoot the guy who just rewarded you for completing a mission, you can. I've already been playing this game, CoP for about 15 hours and haven't even started with the mainline story missions, there's so much else you can do.Not to mention this game is so DYNAMIC. Enemies get into firefights if they're in opposing groups, or mutants against humans. Bandits and other stalkers will loot dead bodies after killing them. Wounded enemies can either be healed with one of your medkits or executed. Wild packs of mutants will kill human AI and drag their bodies off to be eaten. And anomolies don't discriminate against who they destroy. These are things that were in all of the STALKER games, mind you.If you do decide to get this game, be sure to download either the complete (better graphics, improved gameplay, bug fixes) or the Misery (same as Complete only a LOT harder) mods. They're a good pick for even a first time run through, though I would only do Misery if you are really patient and don't mind dying a lot.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
												While an enjoyable game on its own, this game can support various mods to greatly expand its horizons. Suggested mods - 1.    MISERY - for its challenge and great amount of added content.2.    Call of Chernobyl - for all the locations added from each game, although quest content is low, there is still plenty to explore, collect, loot and shoot, with the mod creators updating it periodically. This is a freeplay mod, essentially.Both mods can be found on Moddb.Both of the above mods make the bloodsuckers almost always invisible when engaged, with no shimmer.This game does have some unintentional jump scares.The only drawbacks are the infrequent game crashes.I would recommend this game. One of the interesting parts of the game is just in exploring the underground labs and abandoned bases.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Call of Pripyat is the third game in the outstanding S.T.A.L.K.E.R series, and the most recently released and most recent in the in-game chronology. You play as USS Special Agent Major Degtyarev, sent to investigate the failure of a airborne assault into the center of the Zone. Eventually, you will be give free-reign over 3 large and well-made overworlds:Zaton, the start;Yanov, the area surrounding the Jupiter plant; and Pripyat, the city closest to the CNPP.PROS+Atmosphere rarely fails to scare or instill a sense of awe in you.+Many side missions, random events, and emissions to keep you on your toes.+Varied and effective (or ineffective) types of weapons and armor+Many types of mutants, ranging from mutated dogs to massive mutated humans who have become little more than a head and legs.+The natural enviroment is teeming with radiation and 'anomalies', which can burn you with fire, melt you with acid, make your head explode, and send you flying, amongst others+Few bugs, compared to Clear Sky+Active and varied modding community, home to one of the best mods I've ever played: MISERYCONS-Its age often causes technical problems, leading to either lag or inoperabillity-Dated vanilla graphics and sound-Gunplay is unforgiving and disorientating to new players.-Little hope of a sequel (unless the newly reformed GSC is working on one without my knowladge.)-Possible(?) lack of support for some headphones; I've had issues getting mine to work correctly occasionally.OVERALLAudio-7/10Visuals-8/10Gameplay-10/10Multiplayer-0/10 (no longer supported)S.T.A.L.K.E.R: Call of Pripyat, overall, is an amazing game. No other game has scared me as much as this game has, and it improved upon the best and worst parts of both Clear Sky and Shadow of Chernobyl. The modding community has updated its graphics and sound, added new weapons, mutants, and changed fundamental aspects of it while still keeping it true to its roots. However, it's plagued by constant crashes on some machines, incompatabillity with overlays (possibly including the Steam In-Game Overlay), and the lack of supported multiplayer. However, this game is mostly only single-player, so that barely dents this nearly flawless game.Final Grade-9/10NOTE: As I stated, there are many mods for this game. As such, I'll include a short list of the ones I believe that most people will enjoy and appreciate.|BEGINNER MODS/MODPACKS|CoP: Complete-a visual overhaul of the vanilla game, adds little else. Perfect for a first playthrough.AtmosFEAR-A redesign of the weather effects in-gameMost armor and weaponry mods will fall into this catagory|INTERMEDIARY MODS/MODPACKS|Some weapon mods will change how weapons work/how often they're found/what condition they will be found in. This will drastically change how the game plays. Such mods will fall into this catagory.MISERY:Rookie Mode-A subset of the MISERY mod that dials back the difficulty slightly. Good for second or third playthroughs. Download the most updated version of MISERY and simply enable Rookie Mod whenever it gives you the choice.|ADVANCED MODS/MODPACKS|MISERY-A complete overhaul of CoP's weapons, armor, mutants, visuals, audio, and weather. Removes many easy ways to gain cash to increase difficulty, and also increases weapon damage significantly, both for you and any and all NPC's. The quintessential S.T.A.L.K.E.R experience.Most mods that change the main story or mess with integral mechanics fall here|THE BLACK ROAD|This subset of the MISERY mod falls in its own catagory due to it's masochistic level of difficulty. Same as the MISERY Mod, except that you start with a flashlight, a knife, no map, no food, no ammo or weapons inside of a compound FILLED with zombies. Simply getting out of the starting area can create levels of frustration far in excess of a large portion of Dark Souls' story mode. The sun also gives you radiation poisoning, meaning you will have to choose between glowing to death, or getting ripped apart by the nocturnal mutants of the Zone. Do not play this unless you have mastered everything there is to know about the MISERY mod and S.T.A.L.K.E.R itself.

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												If ever there was a fantastic FPS that spat in the faces of genre conventions and flew under the radar as it showed what creativity looks like in this era of gaming, itd be the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series. This series and its developers gave birth to the Metro series. The excellent Atmospheric FPS series that rose from the ashes after the death of GSC and the STALKER series. This series has some of the best atmosphere ever seen in first-person shooters. Metro continued that tradition and arguably has better atmosphere albeit in a smaller space. The only FPS that comes to mind in atmosphere to me at the moment would be The Darkness video game from 2007 by Starbreeze.Long version with possible spoilers. STALKER takes place in a fictional modern times where the Chernobyl power plant accident had lasting and terrifying effects on the earth and wildlife around it. Mutants, deadly fauna, radiation pockets, killer anomalies, clashing factions and bandits all exist and contend with each other in this post-apocolyptic slice of Ukraine. The radioactive fallout from the reactor cores exploding left Chernobyl and its outlying towns abandoned by civilians and open to the exploitation factions and mercenaries. The Atmosphere gives a bleak outlook with people dying constantly in gruesome ways from being mauled to drowning in radioactive water or being torn to pieces by a viscious anomally. Mutants roam the contrysides looking for fresh food from anyone or anything. Bandits harass every faction or person they can find and often shoot on sight just to save themselves some trouble. Scientists have mercenaries working to protect them as they fight to keep their research continuing and out of the wrong hands. The military constantly tries to muscle its way in to take control of everything, and is allied with no one but themselves. There are 2 main factions Duty and Freedom. They constantly fight each other for differing beliefs while the military tries to control the zone entirely. Throughout the game you'll get opportunities to support whatever factions you'd like, even the bandits, and with several more factions that i didn't list being in the game, the possibilities are many and varied.The Atmosphere is stunning and is oozing with detail. The gamplay itself is great, not the pinnacle of first-person shooters but solid across the board and excelling in certain aspects. The gunplay is precise but also has a nice level of upredictability that challenges the player. Often a small encounter with as little as 2 or 3 well armed soldiers can quickly lead to your death if not handled well and without precise shooting. There isn't a massive amount of different guns to be found but each gun will carry distict advantages or disadvantages. All weapons are upgradable and customizable with upgrade trees and attachments, leading to more meaningful weapon statistic differences and each weapon type has at least 2 ammunition types for different enemies. There are many different armor suits to find, some of them come with a helmet attached, some you can choose the helmet or gasmask you want. All the armors and helmets are also upgradeable with upgrade trees that give different bonuses. You can kill a soldier off in the distance whose gun you want and claim it for your own, or you can do missions around the local stronghold or your favorite faction and earn new armor, guns and ammo, some of them faction specific.The story is pretty good and has many different paths to take. There's many endings and many interesting characters. The game doesn't have much voice acting or at least not in the english version, but the story still holds its own. Its an intersting setting with cool ideas and at the center of it stands The Zone. The big mystery of the entire game. What is The Zone? Is it sentient? Does it control all the creatures that have resulted from the fallout? Does it have psychic abilities? Did it cause all the chaos and damage? Is it afraid of humans? So many questions, so many theories and so many people fighting over ideals and the opportunity to get to the center of the entire incident, The Zone. Everything about this game is well done and well thought out. The gunplay is solid accross the board. the graphics are great and at the time, were cutting edge. The atmosphere is rivaled only by a select few in the genre. The story is interesting. The setting is unique as is the premise. The RPG elements are great but not overbearing to those who aren't fans of the genre. All in all this game is the best and most refined game of a series of amazing and undervalued games from the 2000-2010 decade. It is a must buy to Metro fans, FPS fans, hardcore gamers and pretty much anyone who enjoys a great atmosphere and an excellent melting pot of awesome mechanics. The game has done its part to earn its loyal fan base and you owe to yourself to at least try it out. Pick up the 1st game, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl, and see where it takes you. I'd bet good money you won't be dissapointed. Graphics 8.5/10 (9.5 in 2007 when SoC 1st released).Gameplay 9/10Story 8.5/10Atmosphere 10/10Call of Pripyat gets a 9.5/10 from me. The entire series gets a 9/10.  [/spoiler]

content:
Posted: July 20, 2012
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is GSC Game World's magnum opus. They went out with a bang by making not only the best game in the series but their best game ever.S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat is a First-Person Shooter / Role-Playing / Survival Horror game. It's what happens when you take the best elements of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl and S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky, stick them together and add open-world exploration into the mix.After the slight misstep that was Clear Sky, GSC Game World listened to the fans, did a complete turn in the other direction and went back to what made Shadow of Chernobyl such fun to play.Call of Pripyat is set after Shadow of Chernobyl. You play as an undercover military agent, Alex Degtyarev. You are sent into the Zone to find out why a party of helicopters, that were advancing into the Zone after the events in Shadow of Chernobyl took place, crashed.This is without a doubt the most polished game of the series. The game gives you three incredibly huge open areas for you to explore however you want, with lots of side missions to do and things to find. Exploration has a heavier focus now than it did over the last two games.The "A-Life" system, artificial life designed to react worldwide to what happens in the Zone, is now better then ever, monsters will move into places that might have been previously been occupied by humans or other mutants. This makes locations around the Zone a constantly unsafe place to live, especially at night.GSC Game World also brought back the visual and sound indicators as well as the need to eat and drink. You can now also sleep if you want but be sure to eat something before you sleep.The story is also mush improved over S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky and whilst this game keeps the horror parts pretty short, the mutants are just as terrifying as always.Nothing more really needs to be said, excellent story, excellent combat as always, an experience you will not forget for a long time. If you enjoyed the previous games, Shadow of Chernobyl in particular, then get this game. You will not regret it!P.S. Grab the "CALL OF PRIPYAT COMPLETE" modification to enhance the textures, fix any remaining bugs and small translation issues.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2012
												This is my favorite game from the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series and in general it is a very fun game with a relaxed and mature community.Call of Pripyat may not be for everyone though, it is sometimes creepy and also eerie. None the less it is still very fun, the game has a fine exploration aspect that the previous games did not touch on so much.Call of Pripyat also has more RPG elements or simply more polished ones than the previous installments. Weapon upgrades, Suit upgrades and the overall gameplay feels very free and not claustrophobic.This game has alot of popular modifications that overhaul some parts of it, many popular such as Misery, Redux & AtmosFear 3.All of these mods polish the game and make it fun. The S.T.A.L.K.E.R series in general are pretty difficult, it is recommended to begin with Shadow of Chernobyl as Call of Pripyat is the latest installment. It's worth the money. Hopefully this helped~

												If I would be one of those insufferable tw@ts, who post "1000 Movies You Must Watch Before You Die" lists, but for games, I would definitely include Call of Pripyat in the list.It's not sharpest of the story premises, but this is all about immersive atmoshpere of exploring desolate construction sites with an undertone of childish desire for constant looking for something of interest (be that either a piece of someone's history in a form of faded photograph, or a dirty harmonica, or just that basic thrill of doing something potentially dangerous and challenging)"Stalker" gives you all of it and then some, and this third installment of the series provides the most polished experience of the Zone as of yet, so do check it out.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												Let's be frank here. I've played games since I picked up an N64 controller when I was two, that was way back in '97, and I haven't regretted it since.That being said, this game is terrifying, between the invisible Cthulhu Men and what I assume are the Former Soviet union's attempt at creating a Pokemon (Psy dogs, come on, fight me). This game has the atmosphere of an Alfred Hitchcock film, and it delivers like a full steel-toed boot to the face.I love it. I love the fact that vodka gets rid of radiation. I love the fact that I can shoot spoopy ghosts, and I love the fact that I can just pilfer through the bodies of my enemies and steal their vodka, ammo, and canned food. This game isn't the least bit friendly, you will die, you will cry, both from anger and fear, and you will♥♥♥♥♥♥your trousers when you accidentally fall into a snork cave.Get this game, get your vodka and get out of here Stalker.
